title: 2 cloves garlic 4 tomatoes 4 cups vegetable broth 1 teaspoon cumin 1 teaspoon coriander 1 teaspoon turmeric 1 teaspoon salt 1/4 cup cilantro Instructions :  Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. Add diced tomatoes, lentils, chickpeas, vegetable broth, cumin, coriander,  turmeric, and salt. Simmer for 30 minutes until lentils are tender. Stir in chopped cilantro and serve warm.  Horta  Ingredients :  1 pound dandelion greens 1/4 cup olive oil 1/4 cup lemon juice 1 teaspoon salt Instructions :  Boil dandelion greens until tender, then drain. Toss greens with olive oil, lemon juice, and salt. Serve warm or chilled.  Hot and Sour Soup  Ingredients :  4 cups chicken broth 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms 1/4 cup bamboo shoots 1/4 cup tofu 2 tablespoons soy sauce 2 tablespoons rice vinegar 1 tablespoon cornstarch 1 teaspoon chili paste 1 egg 1/4 cup chopped green onions Instructions :  Bring chicken broth to a boil. Add mushrooms, bamboo shoots, tofu, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and chili paste. Mix cornstarch with water and add to the soup, stirring until thickened. Beat egg and slowly pour into the soup, stirring constantly. Garnish with chopped green onions and serve.

outline.text: o 1 pound dandelion greens o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions :
o 2 cloves garlic o 4 tomatoes o 4 cups vegetable broth o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon coriander o 1 teaspoon turmeric o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup cilantro  Instructions :

o 4 cups chicken broth o 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms o 1/4 cup bamboo shoots o 1/4 cup tofu o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 2 tablespoons rice vinegar o 1 tablespoon cornstarch o 1 teaspoon chili paste o 1 egg o 1/4 cup chopped green onions  Instructions :
o Boil dandelion greens until tender, then drain. o Toss greens with olive oil, lemon juice, and salt. o Serve warm or chilled. Hot and Sour Soup
turmeric, and salt. o Simmer for 30 minutes until lentils are tender. o Stir in chopped cilantro and serve warm. Horta
 Ingredients :
Hummus
o 1 can chickpeas o 1/4 cup tahini o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions :

o 8 ounces sweet potato noodles o 1/2 pound beef o 1 small onion o 1 carrot o 1 bell pepper o 1 cup spinach o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 tablespoon sesame seeds  Instructions :

o Drain and rinse chickpeas. o Blend chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, and salt in a food processor. o Slowly add olive oil while blending until smooth. o Serve with a drizzle of olive oil. Japchae
until cooked. o Add spinach and cook until wilted. o Mix noodles with soy sauce, sugar, and sesame seeds. o Combine with cooked beef and vegetables. o Serve warm. Jerk Vegetables
o 1/4 cup olive oil  Instructions :
o 2 cups flour o 1/4 cup sugar o 1 tablespoon baking powder o 1/2 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup butter o 1/2 cup milk o Oil for frying  Instructions :

o 2 cups rice o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 4 tomatoes o 1/4 cup tomato paste o 1/4 cup vegetable oil o 1 teaspoon thyme o 1 teaspoon curry powder o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper o 4 cups chicken broth  Instructions :

o Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. o Cut in cold butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. o Add milk and stir until dough forms. o Roll out dough and cut into circles. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Jollof Rice
o Toss vegetables with minced garlic, jerk seasoning, and olive oil. o Roast at 400°F (200°C) until tender. o Serve warm. Johnny Cakes
Kachumbari
o 2 cups flour o 1/2 cup milk o 3 eggs o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg o 1/4 cup butter o 1 cup grated cheese o 1 small onion  Instructions :
o 4 tomatoes o 1 small onion o 1 cucumber o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions :
o Dice tomatoes, onion, and cucumber. o Mix vegetables with chopped cilantro, lemon juice, and salt. o Serve chilled. Käsespätzle (Cheese Noodles)

o Mix flour, milk, beaten eggs, salt, and nutmeg to form a batter. o Press batter through a spaetzle maker or colander into boiling water. o Cook until spaetzle floats to the surface, then drain. o Sauté sliced onion in butter until golden. o Layer spaetzle and grated cheese in a baking dish, top with sautéed onion. o Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 15 minutes until cheese is melted. o Serve warm. Kartoffelsalat (Potato Salad)
egg, oregano, mint, salt, and pepper in a bowl. o Form mixture into meatballs. o Heat oil in a pan and fry meatballs until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Kibbeh
o 1 cup bulgur o 1/2 pound ground beef o 1 small onion o 1/4 cup pine nuts o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon allspice o 1 teaspoon salt o Oil for frying  Instructions :

o 1/2 pound ground beef o 1/2 pound ground pork o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup breadcrumbs o 1 egg o 1 teaspoon oregano o 1 teaspoon mint o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper o Oil for frying  Instructions :

o Boil potatoes until tender, then dice. o Cook diced bacon until crispy, then remove and set aside. o Sauté diced onion in bacon fat until softened. o Mix vinegar, chicken broth, mustard, sugar, salt, and pepper in a bowl. o Combine potatoes, bacon, and onion with the dressing. o Serve warm or chilled. Keftedes
 Instructions :
Kimchi

green onions in a bowl. o Rub mixture onto cabbage leaves. o Pack cabbage into a jar and let ferment at room temperature for 2-3 days. o Store in the refrigerator and serve as needed. Kongnamul Muchim
o 1 napa cabbage o 1/4 cup sea salt o 1 tablespoon sugar o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 2 tablespoons gochugaru (Korean chili powder) o 4 cloves garlic o 1 inch ginger o 4 green onions  Instructions :
o 1 pound soybean sprouts o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil o 1 tablespoon sesame seeds  Instructions :
o 2 cups yogurt o 1/2 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup olive oil  Instructions :
o Blanch soybean sprouts in boiling water for 2 minutes, then drain. o Mix minced garlic, soy sauce, sesame oil, and sesame seeds in a bowl. o Toss sprouts with the dressing. o Serve chilled. Labneh
Larb

o 1/2 pound ground chicken o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 2 tablespoons lime juice o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 tablespoon rice powder o 1/4 cup mint o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1-2 Thai chilies  Instructions :

o 8 ounces lo mein noodles o 1 cup sliced bell peppers o 1 cup snow peas o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon oyster sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil  Instructions :

o Cook lo mein noodles according to package instructions, then drain. o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in sesame oil until fragrant. o Add bell peppers and snow peas, stir-fry until tender. o Add cooked noodles, soy sauce, and oyster sauce, stir to combine. o Serve warm. Loubia

o Sauté ground chicken, diced onion, and minced garlic until cooked. o Mix fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, and rice powder in a bowl. o Toss chicken with the dressing, chopped mint, cilantro, and sliced chilies. o Serve with lettuce leaves. Lo Mein
o 1 teaspoon paprika o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup cilantro  Instructions :
o 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast o 1 teaspoon sugar o 1 cup warm water o 3 cups flour o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1/4 cup za'atar  Instructions :
o 2 cups elbow macaroni o 2 cups milk o 2 tablespoons butter o 2 tablespoons flour o 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions :

o Cook macaroni according to package instructions, then drain. o Melt butter in a saucepan, stir in flour to make a roux. o Gradually add milk, stirring constantly until thickened. o Add cheese, salt, and pepper, stir until melted. o Combine cheese sauce with macaroni. o Serve warm. Manakish

o Soak beans overnight, then cook until tender. o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until softened. o Add diced tomatoes, cumin, paprika, and salt, simmer for 10 minutes. o Mix beans with tomato sauce and cook for 10 minutes. o Stir in chopped cilantro and serve warm. Macaroni and Cheese
Mandazi
o 1 cup glutinous rice o 1 cup coconut milk o 1/4 cup sugar o 1/4 teaspoon salt o 2 mangoes  Instructions :

o 1 package dumpling wrappers o 1/2 pound ground pork o 1/2 cup chopped cabbage o 1/4 cup chopped green onions o 2 cloves garlic o 1 tablespoon soy sauce o 1 teaspoon sesame oil o Oil for frying  Instructions :
o 2 cups flour o 1/4 cup sugar o 1 tablespoon baking powder o 1/2 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup coconut milk o 1/4 cup water o Oil for frying  Instructions :

o Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. o Add coconut milk and water, stir until dough forms. o Roll out dough and cut into triangles. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Mandu

o Mix ground pork, cabbage, green onions, minced garlic, soy sauce, and sesame o Place a spoonful of filling on each wrapper and fold to seal. o Fry in hot oil until golden, then steam for 5 minutes. o Serve with dipping sauce. Mango Sticky Rice

o 1 block tofu o 1/2 pound ground pork o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 tablespoon chili bean paste o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon rice wine o 1 teaspoon sugar o 1/4 cup chicken broth o 1 tablespoon cornstarch o 1/4 cup chopped green onions  Instructions :
o 4 potatoes o 1/2 cup milk o 1/4 cup butter o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions :

o Cut tofu into cubes and set aside. o Sauté ground pork, diced onion, and minced garlic until browned. o Add chili bean paste, soy sauce, rice wine, and sugar, cook for 2 minutes. o Add chicken broth and tofu, simmer for 5 minutes. o Mix cornstarch with water and add to the pan, stirring until thickened. o Garnish with chopped green onions and serve. Mashed Potatoes
o Mix coconut milk with cooked rice and let sit for 10 minutes. o Serve rice with sliced mangoes. Mapo Tofu
o Peel and dice potatoes. o Boil potatoes until tender, then drain. o Mash potatoes with milk, butter, salt, and pepper. o Serve warm. Minestrone
o 1 can diced tomatoes o 4 cups vegetable broth o 1 can cannellini beans o 1 cup pasta o 1/4 cup basil o 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese  Instructions :
o 4 bananas o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 bell pepper o 2 tomatoes o 1 cup coconut milk o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper  Instructions :
o 4 cups dashi broth o 1/4 cup miso paste o 1/2 cup tofu o 1/4 cup green onions o 1/4 cup seaweed  Instructions :

o Heat dashi broth until warm. o Dissolve miso paste in a small amount of broth, then add to the pot. o Add diced tofu and seaweed. o Simmer for 5 minutes. o Garnish with sliced green onions and serve. Moqueca de Banana

o Sauté diced onion, carrots, celery, and minced garlic until softened. o Add diced zucchini, tomatoes, and broth. o Bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes. o Add beans and pasta, cook until pasta is tender. o Stir in chopped basil and serve with grated Parmesan cheese. Miso Soup
Msemen
molasses, cumin, and salt in a food processor until smooth. o Serve with pita bread. Mutabal
o 2 cups flour o 1 cup semolina o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 cup water o 1/4 cup butter  Instructions :
o 2 eggplants o 1/4 cup tahini o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions :
o 2 red bell peppers o 1/2 cup walnuts o 1/4 cup breadcrumbs o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 tablespoon pomegranate molasses o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions :

o Mix flour, semolina, and salt in a bowl. o Add water and knead until smooth. o Divide dough into balls and roll out into thin circles. o Brush with melted butter and fold into squares. o Cook on a hot griddle until golden on both sides. o Serve warm. Muhammara
o 1 green papaya o 2 carrots o 1/4 cup peanuts o 1/4 cup cilantro o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 2 tablespoons lime juice o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1-2 Thai chilies  Instructions :
o 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast o 1 teaspoon sugar o 1/2 cup warm water o 2 1/2 cups flour o 1/2 cup yogurt o 1/4 cup melted butter o 1 teaspoon salt  Instructions :

o Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water, let sit until foamy. o Mix flour and salt in a bowl, then add yeast mixture, yogurt, and melted butter. o Knead until smooth, then let rise until doubled. o Divide dough into balls and roll out into circles. o Cook on a hot griddle until bubbles form, then flip and cook the other side. o Brush with melted butter and serve warm. Nom Du Du (Green Papaya Salad)

o Peel and shred green papaya and carrots. o Crush peanuts and chop cilantro. o Mix fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, and sliced chilies in a bowl. o Toss shredded papaya, carrots, peanuts, and cilantro with the dressing. o Serve chilled. Nuoc Cham
processor. o Slowly add olive oil while blending until smooth. o Serve with a drizzle of olive oil. Naan
o 2 cloves garlic o 1-2 Thai chilies o 1/4 cup water  Instructions :
o 2 cucumbers o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil o 1 tablespoon gochugaru (Korean chili powder) o 1 tablespoon sesame seeds  Instructions :
o 2 cups cooked sushi rice o 1/4 cup filling (salmon, pickled plum) o 1 sheet nori (seaweed)  Instructions :
o 2 cups tapioca flour o 1 cup milk o 1/2 cup butter o 1 teaspoon salt o 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese o 2 eggs  Instructions :
o Mix fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, minced garlic, and sliced chilies in a bowl. o Add water and stir until sugar is dissolved. o Serve as a dipping sauce. Oi Muchim
o Slice cucumbers thinly. o Mix minced garlic, soy sauce, sesame oil, gochugaru, and sesame seeds in a bowl. o Toss cucumbers with the dressing. o Serve chilled. Onigiri (Rice Balls)
o Wet hands and shape rice into balls or triangles. o Make a small indentation and add filling. o Wrap with a strip of nori. o Serve immediately. Pão de Queijo

o 8 ounces rice noodles o 1/2 pound shrimp o 2 eggs o 1 cup bean sprouts o 1/4 cup peanuts o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 2 tablespoons tamarind paste o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 tablespoon lime juice o 1/4 cup green onions  Instructions :

o 8 ounces wide rice noodles o 1/2 pound chicken breast o 1 cup broccoli o 2 eggs o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 2 tablespoons oyster sauce o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 tablespoon vegetable oil  Instructions :

o Remove from heat and stir in tapioca flour until smooth. o Let cool slightly, then mix in grated cheese and beaten eggs. o Form dough into balls and place on a baking sheet. o Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden. o Serve warm. Pad See Ew
o Soak rice noodles in warm water until softened, then drain. o Sauté shrimp in a pan until cooked, then set aside.

o Soak rice noodles in warm water until softened, then drain. o Sauté sliced chicken in vegetable oil until cooked, then set aside. o Scramble eggs in the same pan. o Add noodles, soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar, stir to combine. o Add broccoli and cooked chicken, stir-fry until heated through. o Serve warm. Pad Thai
